website_summaries.verdict: If you are convinced that vacuum tubes provide better sound than typical solid state devices, then this amp is for you.
pros: Captures that "warm, tune sound" that audiophiles love quite well
cons: they will need to be replaced overtime and can be quite expensive

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, Good Little Amp!
customer_reviews.text: Good little amp. I broke the stock tube pulling off the lid. My bad. The Groove Tube sounded better anyway. The design is pretty good, I have no complaints. I don't care for the color, but it doesn't bother me. Still braking it in, so we will see how long it last and if it starts sounding better. I would recommend this unit if you need a good headphone amp! I really like the inputs and outputs on this device. Two sizes of headphone jacks, awesome. Some say it gets really hot, but mine doesn't get really hot. You can still touch it.Has plenty of power for almost anything.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Fultz

customer_reviews.title: Pops when you turn it on
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to start by saying I'm not an expert at all with audio stuff. I bought this to drive a pair of Sennheiser 6xx (Massdrop version of HD 650) headphones. This amp is really cool looking and built well. I use it for my computer, but I plan on making it a turntable amplifier in the future because I need a DAC. The biggest issue I have with it is that it pops when you turn it on. Whether or not this is unsafe for your headphones, I don't know. I play it safe and turn it on before plugging in my headphones. I advise you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rotuno-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing headphone amp
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, I upgraded the tubes to mullard from the stock and it is def worth it, much more detail and sound quality. Its powering a pair of hard to drive 20ohm tin hifi P1 that no other headphone amps i tried could bring to life the same way. You dont need this for a pair of IEMs like my westone umpro50, they sound great with less exp amps but for some real power and class A this is it. Compared to a schiit magna 3 this blows it away and that is rated 3 times as powerful. Tube sound is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little amp!
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp. Not sure I can add much to previous reviews - pretty warm/clean sound, does get a little warm to the touch, but that's just what they do. I bought it to improve sound and get around the cell phone MP3 player's annoying volume nanny. I am very pleased with it. Actually considering buying a 2nd. The only con I've found so far is that if you leave the little transformer that comes with it plugged it, ever once in a while it makes a clicking sound. I only noticed it because I'm using it in the bedroom and it woke me up. I just keep it unplugged when I'm not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason in TX

customer_reviews.title: Bravo Audio Ocean tube headphone amplifier
customer_reviews.text: I like these Bravo Audio Ocean tube headphone amplifiers. They give that magical touch to the harsh digital recordings. The stock tubes that come installed on these seem good to me. I can hear a difference in the musical recordings using this tube and it seems ok. I just let my ears be the judge. This is my third one and I thought about swapping the tube on the third one but will wait until the tube needs to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Jaysen A. Delauney

customer_reviews.title: OutSTANDING product.
customer_reviews.text: Truly, one of the more outstanding products I've purchased in the last few years. This thing is a beast (it's tough), made to take on a tank, and win. The sound clarity is EVERYTHING promised, it fact, it's actually better than promised. It runs warm, like all tube amplifiers, so leave plenty of room around it so that it air cools properly - this will help it stay stable and keep the clarity to a maximum. Truly, an impressive device.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Warm Sounding
customer_reviews.text: This is a warm sounding and inexpensive amp. It is capable of driving most headphones and will improve your listening experience with headphones. It colors the sound mildly and gives a nice bass. The unit appears well constructed; it should last.
customer_reviews.author: Disinterested Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Two big thumbs up for this little amp
customer_reviews.text: Shockingly good little amp for the price. But wouldn't recommend for families with young children 'cause this case gets super hot once tube warms up. Produces very nice sound though & would make a really nice starter tube amp for some one needing an amp for their headphone(s). Lacks usb input which would be nice but works well with phones, iPads, music players, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Austinhorn

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Giving it 4 stars due to how hot the unit gets. Sound is warm and easily powers hard to drive headphones. Also, every so often a crackling sound appears but goes away in a few minutes I have not been able to troubleshoot the issue with the sound yet.
customer_reviews.author: Vahe

customer_reviews.title: WoW!!! Unbelievable sound.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. If you have high impedance headphones this amp is for you. Amazing difference from the solid state amp I was using.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: I have enjoyed this little amp - even though I suspect my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this little amp - even though I suspect my aged ears can't fully appreciate the subtle sound quality difference. Just something magical about lighting up a 20th century tube to amplify music from the 60s. :)
customer_reviews.author: Hawk521

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, then the static
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this amp. I even bought a new tube for it. Unfortunately 6 months in, it started getting static intermittently. I've emailed Bravo 3x and they have yet to respond. Terrible customer service and no phone number.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Really Great
customer_reviews.text: Im using this amp with a AKG K7XX and wors great really improve the sound i totally recommend it
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: I really like this amp
customer_reviews.text: I really like this amp. It is affordable and sounds pretty good. Needs a better tube, but I can't be bothered to replace the default one, and I'll wait for it to burn out whenever that happens before I replace it. Its really really sharp and loud at first and I found it hard to listen to at first, but once the tube mellowed out after about a week or two, I found the range to be good.
customer_reviews.author: SEMC

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfactory
customer_reviews.text: A nice little headphone amplifier. I find this far better sound quality from a DVD recording than that provided by the TV sound system and better for dialogue intelligibility than my external sound bar
customer_reviews.author: EdPhotog

customer_reviews.title: It is nice looking though
customer_reviews.text: Unit dead on arrival. It is nice looking though.....unfortunately never got to hear it. Returned it and was issued a fast refund. Went with Nobsound brand amp instead which works and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good amp for the money when you switch the tube to a Genalex Gold Lion 12AU7 Tube
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What a great little amp
customer_reviews.text: What a great little amp. It sounds wonderful with my Sennheiser HD 570's I did replace the tube with a gold lion and the sound is very mellow, with good highs and nice base. I am getting a Sennheiser HD 700 for Christmas and I can't wait to hear what this is going to sound like with them.
customer_reviews.author: Navair tech

customer_reviews.title: only one channel works
customer_reviews.text: the audio quality is good. But on both 1/4" and RCA out only one channel works. The item is now not available for exchange, only return and money back. I want to keep the unit but I need it repaired or exchanged for a working unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Iniguez

customer_reviews.title: power cable is JUNK
customer_reviews.text: the power cable is a piece of junk ...the amp sounds very good, but good luck trying to power it ... cable won't work
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P King

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphone amplifier.
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphone amp with plenty of power for the various Sennheiser, AKG, JBL, etc., headphones I have. Sound is very good. No noticeable roll off of highs or too much emphasis on bass. Highly recommended. I hope to use its capabilities as a preamp with an amplifier in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H.

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing - noise floor is high
customer_reviews.text: The sound of this unit is very pleasing, and it matches very well with my Sennheiser 558's. The downside is that the noise floor is a lot higher than I was expecting. Of course when you're listening it's gone, but I find it generally unacceptable (I listen to a lot of classical music). I'm going to try a different tube to see if I can get it under control, but if that doesn't work I'm going to move on. Edit: One other thing I forgot to mention, the power LED is insanely bright. :)
customer_reviews.author: PenName

customer_reviews.title: Bravo Audio Ocean Mini Valve Class A Tube
customer_reviews.text: Purchased from ProStudio Sound & Music thru amazon. Item delivered 2 days fast. Pack'd perfect. ProStudio Sound & Music answered my needed information quick and clear. This lil class A tube amp has awesome price and high 5 STARS reviews. I've yet to break the tube in and test it out but I have no concern it will live up to it's reviews.
customer_reviews.author: BabeLaStrange

customer_reviews.title: Nice little amp that takes the edge off cheaper headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Where I work I need to use a so-so headset on a PC with no volume control and due to restrictions I cant replace the headset with something nicer. This little amp allows me to control the volume nicely and it seems to reduce the uncomfortable tinnyness you get out of cheaper headsets/headphones. My only ding on this product is the front LED. That sucker is extremely bright!
customer_reviews.author: M. Lezon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Amp for the $
customer_reviews.text: Great little tube amp for the money. It definitely makes my Master and Dynamic MH 40 phones sound fuller in the low/mid range. I've had my unit for 6 months and it continues to perform well. Unit get's pretty warm, but I have not found it to be a concern. Only criticism is the red LED on the front panel is too bright. Overall a good value for the $.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good little tube amp
customer_reviews.text: Nice little headphone tube amp. Though I'm not sure if it's worth $119 that I paid for it. But I was willing to give it a try. Sound quality is good and build is good. 4 stars because I think the cost could be lower.
customer_reviews.author: JustinLA

customer_reviews.title: Okay for a start...
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed this headphone amp for a while, and I'll give it credit (blame?) for starting me listening to tube amps and the joys (and expense) of tube rolling. You get a lot of listening pleasure for the money with the Bravo, but it's basically a toy. The quality is poor and it has limited functionality. I've replaced mine with another headphone amp from an American company with garage in the name, and I'm much happier because it sounds better and lets you roll many, many more kinds of tubes. So this is a good starter amp. but you'll soon want something better.
customer_reviews.author: marko

customer_reviews.title: This can really push your DT-770 and deliver a Quality experienced
customer_reviews.text: it does amp the sound in my Mac pro-book , I use DT-770 and it really drives the hard I hear everything cleaner. The construction if great, metal and heats sinks everywhere. The bright Red LED is a con, its just way too bright. the side screws were protruding so I change them to bevel screws and this prevented my hands touching the heat-sinks on the side. There was no rubber feet so this just slide all around on my desk. I was persuaded to buy the gold tube, NOT worth it, you really can't experience the sound quality difference.
customer_reviews.author: amazon pro

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, zero hiss or any noise. Great build quality. I run this with audio technica m50s, dragonfly dac and a vintage telefunken 6au7 tube amazing sound.
customer_reviews.author: primetime

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant Surprise!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tube headphone amp and due to the price of the unit I thought it may sound ok. I was wrong! Out of the box it was decent but after about 10-15 hours the amp really settled in and became really smooth. Music is just warmer and easier to listen to and get lost in. I would not hesitate to recommend this little tube amp. Keeps getting better the more you listen!
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Amp!!
customer_reviews.text: I own several headphone amps. This one delivers the best sound and the least amount of RFI... Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Dmarcot110

customer_reviews.title: 4 years and still rocking!
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this one on 2012, and so far is still working great!!! I can recommend this product without a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Heizel Yadin Mejia

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is very good to my (admittedly not great) ears
customer_reviews.text: Does what it says. Makes sound louder without adding any noise. Sound quality is very good to my (admittedly not great) ears.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Webber

customer_reviews.title: Great investment.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my purchase of this unit. I use it with my Ipod and PC. It makes MP3's and digital music sound so much better. I use Sennheiser HD280 headphones with it. It sounds like I have a serious sound system now, with very little investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Haseltine

customer_reviews.title: cheap but strong enough to drive my 600ohm T1 well
customer_reviews.text: I bought it because I enjoy rolling different vintage 12au7 which I collected in the past. Currently I am using vintage USA made Tungsol 12au7. Sound more clean and dynamic than the stock tube. be careful with the RCA jack, I broke them when unplugging Monster RCA cables. The major complain is all my headphones experience distortion when playing some piano notes even with different different sources. Other than occasional distortion, the sound is really good thought less details but warmer and mellower then my solid state Grace m9xx.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. It was better
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't know what to expect from this amp. The reviews I read said it made the music sound "warmer". I understand it now. I used a pair of Sennheiser 380 PROs that I had been disappointed with. As it turns out my iPad simply wasn't pushing them enough. This amp has no such issues. If you want your music to sound better without spending a lot this is your amp!
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power from my iPad Air, and from ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power from my iPad Air, and from my iMac Air Pro. Really didn't need the amp with my low 50 ohm headset. Unit works well, and more power than ever, enough for esternal speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Durazo

customer_reviews.title: I have a nice pair of Bose headphones that I had thought were ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a nice pair of Bose headphones that I had thought were more than capable of producing good music along with my sound-card. I was surprised by how much I was missing in my music before I got this amp. Well worth the investment. I would also recommend pairing this device with a dedicated DAC. Trust me on this.
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp that matches perfectly with my DT770 PRO ...
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp that matches perfectly with my DT770 PRO headphones. Looking forward to experimenting with a couple different tubes to achieve different sounds!! Thank you Bravo Audio and Ingenious Ingenuity!!
customer_reviews.author: Woody W

customer_reviews.title: It seems ok so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this amp for 3 weeks and this is the only headphone amp that I have ever had. I'm not sure about the sound. I would personally like a little more warmth. I plan on rolling some different tubes to try to get a sound that I am more comfortable with. It has a lot of power and it has been working flawless. I am mainly using it with 3 particular headphones. AKGQ701, Sennheiser 598, and Beyerdynamic 770 250 ohm. The AKG and the Sennheiser are not bassy headphones so maybe I will never be able to improve the warmth. Bottom line..... The jury is still out. I will update in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: michael schuh

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little amp so far, it does get pretty hot though when it is on.
customer_reviews.author: mack d

customer_reviews.title: Warm sound.
customer_reviews.text: Gives me that tipical warm sound that you get from a tube amplifier for a very low price. A real great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Eddeon

customer_reviews.title: I've had this two days and the sound gets better the more the tube burns in
customer_reviews.text: I've had this two days and the sound gets better the more the tube burns in. Makes listening much more enjoyable. I can listen longer without fatigue. I ordered the $30 tube since the reviews recommended it. However, i can say i'm pleased with the stock tube, too. I just run it out of my iPhone into the Bravo and into my B&O headphones. sounds great. for the price, i am so glad to pick this up.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: small device that packs a big punch
customer_reviews.text: I have nothing bad to say about this small device, but that it's absolutely awesome. I purchased this amp to pair it with my Sennheiser HD 518. I bought them both at the same time, but my Headphones arrived first. I tried them to with any amp and they sound good, but I felt that I was missing something. However, once I receive my amp, which by the way arrived days before the estimated time, it transform my experience with headphones. In addition to that I was able to hook this up with my xbox and It enhance my listening experience on my video-games and on my movies.
customer_reviews.author: victor

customer_reviews.title: Great little amp!
customer_reviews.text: Great little amp for the price, much better when you change out the cheep tube it comes with. Love it,Love it!
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, questionable internal build.....now a paper weight!
customer_reviews.text: I initially thought this was a great little amp, with a great sound. However after a year, I started to get horrible crackling which doesn't appear to be tube related. I suspect is may be bad soldering inside, maybe related to the input jacks. I suppose for the price point I cannot be too surprised, but based on the great reviews, I expected better internal build quality
customer_reviews.author: stuart b brady

customer_reviews.title: Solid value
customer_reviews.text: Stock tube is horrible. Replaced w/ CBS and it sounds far better than the price....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pair it with good headphones (I use a pair of Grado SR 80i)
customer_reviews.text: For the price, incredible sound. Pair it with good headphones (I use a pair of Grado SR 80i), a good source, and it will shine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Christian Navelot

customer_reviews.title: Awful low end, maybe I got a bad one?
customer_reviews.text: No matter what source I plugged into, or how long I left the unit on I could not turn the volume up more than a little or everything would sound distorted. I pulled and seated the tube to no avail. Either I got a bad unit or the other reviewers have not heard a great sounding tube amp.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Class A head AMP
customer_reviews.text: Brough the Bravo Audio Ocean Valve Class A headphone Amplifier to add a little sparkel from my DAC converter from my Apple Computer, works like a champ, I'm HAPPY CAMPER now!
customer_reviews.author: walter n bryant

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sound of this unit, much improved over Bravo's V2 which I also own. Highly recommended, especially for the price! Love it with my AT ATH-M50x cans! Have to state however, I put a vintage tube in to replace the original. I can't speak for the original tube as I replaced it immediately with my RCA tube.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Brown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this little preamp, But I can't hear the ocean. Maybe its the tube.
customer_reviews.author: Ritmo

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: kicks ass, period. Only downside- the red "on" indicator light is a little bright. Generally a great product, it will blow your ears off if you want it to.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Let's me use a headphone with my Samsung flatscreen tv. Occasional pop sound. Probably tube circuitry related.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Alava

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sounds great low noise, clean sound well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Works great!! My HE500 with Artemis cable goes really ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality product!!! Simple and Works great !! My HE500 with Artemis cable goes really well ~!!!
customer_reviews.author: Redbull 12

customer_reviews.title: WELL DESIGNED!
customer_reviews.text: VERY COOL ITEM! Try this company. They have nice products.
customer_reviews.author: C. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Here's why I would not recommend this for anyone
customer_reviews.text: Here's why I would not recommend this for anyone: being ungrounded and extremely high voltage, this amp introduces a monstrous amount of static into any setup and it would not surprise me if it ruined your experience as it did with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Redd

customer_reviews.title: Defective power supply
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this item a glowing review, but it was dead on arrival. I'm sure it is a great unit based on the other reviews, but the power supply was bad. I tried to find another power supply in my electronics closet to swap out, but no luck finding a 24V adaptor. The defective power supply issue was mentioned in other reviews, so I know it is not just me. If you are interested in the Ocean, you can roll the dice on it. Just don't be surprised if it won't power up due to cheap components.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Abrahams

customer_reviews.title: Gets pretty hot. good unit
customer_reviews.text: Gets pretty hot, not easy to take the tube out without risk of breaking it due to the clamp on top. Old version may be better
customer_reviews.author: Sudheer

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived with no visible damage but did not work ...
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived with no visible damage but did not work. I did troubleshoot per instructions but that failed. Requested refund and Amazon reacted quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Taller than most

customer_reviews.title: Beware faulty tubes...
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box. The tube was cracked. I plugged in and tested the amp. No playback. I can't get say how this device actually works, but so far, the impression isn't great.
customer_reviews.author: Zoidboi

customer_reviews.title: Wrong One
customer_reviews.text: This is the headphone amp I ordered. I received the the Bravo V2, it sounds alright but not what I ordered, and not the same price either. I was charged for the Ocean. The amp itself is pretty easy to use, I had ordered a nice tube to use, and there are no directions on to use the amp let alone change the tube. I hope I will get at least the difference of the amps refunded.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome C. Jaynes

customer_reviews.title: The Shiniest Turd
customer_reviews.text: That's what was in the box, folks. Nice packaging, cool blue paint, and an adorable tube in the middle, but it was DOA. Troubleshooting got me nowhere so for now i have a fancy looking paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Pzorf

customer_reviews.title: Replacing the stock tube is highly recommended. It makes my HD6XX sing
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it delivers. Replacing the stock tube is highly recommended. It makes my HD6XX sing :)
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Baluyut

product_meta.title: Bravo Audio Ocean Mini Valve Class A Tube Headphone Amplifier
product_meta.description:
Bravo Audio has been making some waves with their line of Tube powered line headphone amps as well as the Tube powered guitar Booster (please see my other posts for other Bravo Audio offerings). 

Bravo Audio gives you the warmth of a tube in a unique little package. 

 Bravo Audio has been talked about in Audiophile blogs and forums recently and this offering is for the Bravo Ocean which is their flagship offering in their lineup with 12AU7 tube power and performance features normally found in much more expensive Audio products. 

 In this age of MP3's and compressed digital music files, a lot of what the artist intended you to hear from the original master tapes on have been lost with thin sound replications of the original sound. 

 With the warmth and power of the the tube driven Bravo Audio lineup, many of these lost frequencies will come to life through a good pair of headphones to match it with. Hear what you have been missing in your favorite music Bravo Ocean a beautiful looking desktop amp 

Pure Class A amplifier No Crossover distortion

 This is a beautiful looking Tube Class A Headphone Amplifier with Aluminum case to help dissipate heat. 

The Bravo Ocean has 2 x input ports:

3.5mm jack

RCA jacks

You can use either of them connect to audio source (ipod, laptop, iphone etc)

Also features 3 x output ports :

3.5mm jack

6.35mm jack

RCA jacks

You can use either of them connect to Headphone (3.5 or 6.35mm) or to power amp (RCA jacks)

Specifications:



Input Power: DC24V

Input Sensitivity: 100mV

Input Impedance: 100KOhm

Out-Put Impedance: 20 to 600 Ohm

Gain: 30dB

Frequency response: 10Hz-60KHz +/- 0.25dB

Signal/Noise Ratio>90dB

Dynamic range: 84.6dBA(300 ohm) 89.8dBA(33 ohm)

THD: 0.016percent(300 ohm) 0.45percent(33 ohm)

IMD + Noise: 0.045(300 ohm) 0.42(33ohm).
feature_bullets: Powerful Tube sound for Audio players
Class A Headphone Amplifier with Aluminum case to help dissipate heat
All required input/output jacks for connection to any audio source (ipod, laptop, iphone etc)
Small and powerful. Looks great as well

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars195 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
